inn1.comm: Malinga starts with an accurate outswinger, shaping into Farhat's pads. Worked away to square leg
full outswinger, shaping in towards middle, driven to mid-on. Not the sweetest of connections
half-volley, just outside off, a better drive, but straight to mid-off
short of a length, rising towards the chest, fended with an open face, keeps it down
tucks him up with one into the ribs, Farhat uses the wrists to keep it down, and play it to square leg
yorker, on off, nearly slips through, but the think inside edge saves him
big inswinger, and nearly the hat-tricks. Beats him comprehensively, but it is swinging down the leg side
another inswinger, Hafeez is off the mark with a nice clip off the pads. Past square leg. That should relieve Hafeez
Hafeez walks down to counter the inswing, is beaten by it, but takes a leg-bye
length ball, middle and off, punched down the ground to mid-off
full, outside off, swinging away, left alone
Beauty. Almost a fast offbreak. Pitches on a length, in front of leg, makes him play. Farhat makes allowance for movement, but this one surprises him, and beats the edge
outswinger, on a length, in front of off, defended
another outswinger, slight width available, steered away for a single to third man
dug in short, outside off, left alone
outswinger, full and straight, driven nicely, but straight to mid-on
length ball, on off, played with an open face, to point
yorker, middle and leg, dug out by Farhat
short of a length, moving away after pitching middle and off, and Farhat goes after it. A little late too. Beaten
short of a length, middle and off, pushed between cover and mid-off for a single
nice inswinger, shaping in towards off, defended by Hafeez
short of a length, nipping in, worked away for a single to deep square
short of a length, not too wide, Farhat gets close to the line and cuts it to square third man
Hafeez picks one that holds its line outside off, and steers it wide of third man for a couple
slower ball, 123ks, half-volley outside off, but driven straight to cover
dug in short, outside off, sways out of its line
Uppish drive, but there is no extra cover. Farhat drives at a length ball outside off, doesn't bother about keeping it down and it goes between mid-off and cover

Shot. That's something we have not seen from Pakistan so far in the series. Shots played in anger. SHots that will make the bowler think. Superb square-drive here. Short of a length, outside off, he moves across, gets close to the line, and drives with an open face. Between point and cover-point it goes
overcompensates this time, and pitches up on the pads. Farhat will be disappointed he has found fine leg with that flick
short of a length, shaping away from off, defended by Hafeez
inswinger, starts in front of off, left alone
just short of a length, and he rocks back to pull it past midwicket. Intent being shown here
this is the one that holds its line outside off, and beats the cut shot
left alone outside off this time
walks down the wicket, is beaten by an inswinger, but he has got outside the line

Hafeez's horror tour continues. He has played completely down the wrong line. Falling over too. No feet movement. Pitched up just outside off, Hafeez drives, away from the body, presenting the gate. The inswinger bursts through that gate, and hits the off stump
length ball on off, defended towards cover
another length ball, 129ks, no movement, defended in front of off
short of a length, outside off, steered away for a single
now the outswinger, outside off, leaving him, left alone
another outswinger, wider still, left alone again
length ball, into the pads, defended towards mid-on
short, moving away, hence the width, and smashed away wide of point. Aggressive stuff from Farhat
fuller now, in front of off, defended to cover
lovely flick now. Length ball, on the pads, uses his wrists to beat square leg with the shot, and it is timed well enough to go for four
pitched up outside off, swinging away, left alone
short of a length, middle and leg, pushed back to him

third boundary of the over. That's what attacking batting can do, make bowlers bowl loose deliveries. Kula has been trying to not give him any room, and has strayed on the pads again. Glanced fine, fine of fine leg
Azhar into the act too. Full, into the pads, Azhar moves forward, and wrists it wide of mid-on
left alone outside off as Mathews tries to keep this away from his pads
wide outside off again, left alone as it holds its line
short of a length, wide again, left alone
left alone outside off again
another delivery wide outside off, and Azhar lets it go again. One fruitful shot followed by five leaves. Now that's what a tree looks like
length ball on the pads, finds square leg with the flick, and is sent back after instinctively setting off for a suicidal single. Thirmanne hits direct, but Farhat is back in time
length ball, on the pads again, pushed to mid-on
short of a length, just outside off, punched to mid-off
and the change of angle almost works. A beauty too. Short of a length, outside off, Farhat plays for the angle, but the ball holds its line, and beats the edge
this one comes in with the angle, defended with an open face

another ripper from Kula. This is on a length, close to off, and Farhat has to play. He plays for the angle, but it straightens off, and beats the edge. Lovely comeback from Kula after having been hit for three fours in his previous over. Good on Mahela for persisting with him
that's a sixth straight leave from Azhar. He has to do something. Can't let Mathews keep bowling the seventh-eighth stump line outside off
Azhar now jumps out of the crease, and flashes at this outside off. Beaten
length ball, outside off, angling in, driven to mid-off
walks down the track, Mathews keeps on a length outside off, defended again
another leave outside off. This is wide enough to play a regulation cut, but Azhar doesn't

he finally goes after a wide delivery, driving it on the up, through extra cover, in front of sweeper-cover. So last 12 balls from Mathews to Azhar: boundaries off the first and last, and 10 dots in between

Farhat disturbs the rhythm of the bowler again. Slightly straighter than the three previous deliveries, so Farhat feels safer attacking. Clears the front leg, and lofts him over mid-on. One bounce for four
outside off again, and defended again

Farhat goes again, and benefits again. Short, into the body, and he pulls. This gets a bit big on him, and even though Farhat is pulling in front of square, he goes ahead with it. And it goes over mid-on again

width outside off. There is a sweeper-cover in place, but he can't do much. Short of a length, wide, he punches it, using his wrists to place it square of the man in the deep. Chandimal's dive there is not enough
holds its line outside off, and Farhat doesn't go after it
Farhat punches again, but this time straight to sweeper-cover. A rare single now. Thirty-two runs have been scored since the last time they ran a run
short of a length, tucks him up with the leg-stump line, hits the thigh pad

too straight now. Farhat has set in the fear of the cut, and Sri Lanka are dead scared of bowling outside off. This is pitched outside leg, and Farhat moves inside the line, and glances this fine for another four
on the pads again, worked away for an easy single
left alone outside off
well wide again, and left alone again
bowls six inches inside the wide line again, and Azhar shoulders arms again
pitched up, on off, pushed back to him
near run-out. Thick edge towards point, Azhar wants the run, it's his call, but there is no single available. Dilshan hardly had any time to get back and collect the throw from Mendis. Azhar survives
driven to long-off for one
pitched up on the pads, worked away to deep square for one
flighted just outside off, pushed between point and cover for a single
short, into the pads, worked away for an easy single
Azhar walks down the track, gets a leading edge to a length ball outside off, and it flies between cover and point
length ball, on the pads, worked away for an easy single
loopy little length ball outside off, 123ks, driven wide of mid-on for one
short of a length, outside off, opens the face to play to point
looks to run this down to third man for the single that would get his fifty. A little extra bounce, and he is beaten
length ball, on off, placed wide of point, and this time Azhar refuses a legitimate single. Imran is five yards down the pitch, with his arm raised in question
length ball, pitched outside leg, Azhar early into the flick, and misses
similar delivery, and this time he has placed it wide of midwicket for one

full, on the pads, worked away to deep square leg to bring up his fifty. Farhat looks up towards the sky, pumps his fist. Younis Khan is the first man to applaud. What an inspired selection Farhat's has been. Just what Pakistan needed
full, on the pads, played back to Dilshan
shimmies down the track, and plays the resultant half-volley back to Dilshan
length ball, on the pads, can't place it wide of midwicket
short of a length, on the pads, helped away for an easy single
length ball, wide outside off, driven to sweeper-cover for one
drop and run. Well done. Length ball, on off, played with soft hands, towards mid-off, and he steals a single
short of a length, outside off, worked wide of mid-on again for a single. This is better stuff from Pak
another tip and run. Pakistan have had something good to drink. Fourth quick single in the over. Dropped towards point, and the soft hands help them. Farhat applauds Ali's response
chips down the track, gets inside the line of the ball, works it away for a single to deep square
length ball, on the pads, worked away for a single to deep square
short, widish, cut away for a single
length ball, on the pads, driven to long-on for another single
short again, punched to long-off for one
length, on the pads, worked to the left of short fine for a single
short of a length, into the pads, worked around the corner for another single

against the run of play. Farhat has thrown it away. Have Pakistan let Sri Lanka back in? First ball of the Powerplay, short and straight, and Farhat has pulled it about 10 feet to the right of the only man deep on the leg side. Chandimal accepts it gleefully at deep midwicket. Perera's touch of gold continues. Nevertheless a good innings from Farhat
short and wide, and this time Azhar doesn't let it go harmlessly away. He cuts this to the left of point, and to the right of third man
similar ball, and he lets it go this time
that's too wide. Azhar need not play at it. First wide of the innings
nice shot, driven to sweeper-cover for one
length ball, outside off, defended off the front foot
short of a length, punched to the right of point for a single
length ball outside off, driven to cover
short of a length, punched straight to cover again
length ball outside off, defended with an open face
top shot. Length ball, too straight, and he punches it down the ground, with the angle, and between the stumps and mid-on
length ball outside off, played with an open face, to cover-point
length ball, close to off, dropped to the left of short cover, and calls Azhar through for a single
good delivery and a belated but prolonged appeal. Short of a length, seams away, Shafiq chases it, misses it  by a long way, but Sanga and Mahela belt out a long shout
fuller, just outside off, defended to cover
length again, outside off, pushed to cover
closer to off now, the bottom hand drags this towards mid-on
length ball outside off now, driven to cover
short and wide, asking to be hit, which Shafiq does, but gets just the single to sweeper-cover
short of a length, outside off, cut straight to point
angling in, and worked away to deep square for one. That bottom hand drags it squarer than he wants to
Shout for lbw. Azhar has walked well down the wicket, misses, is hit in front of middle and leg, and you can never be sure with these. headed down for my money anyway
short and straight, pulled away for a single
slower ball, full outside off, driven to sweeper-cover for one
length, outside off, holds its line, driven to sweeper-cover for one
short of a length, on off, he stays on the front foot, and swipes this from outside off, and between mid-on and midwicket
length ball, pushed wide of cover for a single
walks down the pitch, and defends a short-of-a-length delivery back to him
Jeevan Mendis saves four here. Short of a length, outside off, and he punches this square, to the left of point, and Mendia makes a diving save
full outside off, driven to sweeper-cover for one
slower ball, on off, cutting away a little, driven to mid-off
nice ball first up. Lovely delivery. On a length, drifting in towards off, sucking him forward, then turning across the bat. Sanga appeals for a stumping, but the foot neither lifted nor dragged out
more drift for him, Azhar is down the crease to get close to the pitch of the ball, and defends
this one doesn't turn, and is down the leg side. Called a wide
drags this one short, and is puled away for a single
flighted outside off, 69ks, punched to short cover
pushed through, and worked away off the pads for a single
short, outside off, turning away, punched down to long-off for one
short of a length, outside off, driven to sweeper-cover
driven back at him, Perera gets a hand to it, deflects it to mid-on
short and wide, cut away to sweeper-cover for one
length ball, into the pads, pushed towards mid-on
short of a length, wide, punched away for a single
Nearly caught and bowled. This is a length ball, just outside off, stops on him, and goes back uppishly. Falls just short of Perera

Mendis strikes. He has been flighting the ball, and has benefitted. Tossed generously wide outside off, Ali doesn't quite get to the pitch of it, drives in front of the body, and is caught at short cover
flighted on off, doesn't turn as much as expected, gets an inside edge onto the pad
more drift for Mendia, Misbah defends with the front pad opening up
flighted again, middle and off, defended off the front foot
googly, too short, 76ks, pulled away for a single
short of a length, and at that pace it becomes short, and he cuts it away to deep point for a single
short of a length, makes a late decision to try to run this down, and is beaten
short of a length, on off, worked away into the leg side with the prominent bottom hand. Wide of long-on it goes
Bottom hand again. Length ball, outside off, he drives it on the up, dragging it to the on side of the punch, and it beats the dive from the fielder at mid-on
short of a length, wide, punched away, can't beat point
short of a length, outside off, worked wide of deep midwicket. All wrists and bottom hand. Misbah comes back for the second, and dives in with time on hand
short, sits up, pulled away to deep midwicket
tossed up on the pads, dropped into the open leg side for one
short of a length, outside off, hurries up on him as he tries to cut. Gets a bottom edge
full toss on the pads, and he has found deep midwicket with his whip
length ball, skiddy, middle and leg, defended
flighted on middle and leg, pushed to long-on for one
short of a length, stays low as it turns away, pushed back to him
full, on the pads, clipped away for a single
short of a length, stump to stump, pushed to short cover
full, on the pads, flicked away for a single
short, too far down leg, Shafiq throws his bat at it, gets enough glove on it to get it wide of Sanga, and well fine of long leg
a proper bouncer now, over the leg stump, and Shafiq ducks under it
slower ball, on a length, on the line of off, defended towards mid-on
googly, turning from just outside off, Misbah goes back and defends
full, on the pads, driven down to long-on for one
googly, but a touch too short, and even though Shafiq has not read it early he has enough time to recover. Was shaping up to cut it before it began turning back in
picks the googly this time, and works it into the on side for one
full, on the pads, lapped away for a single
short, turning away, cut straight to point
short of a length, into the pads, helped away for a single
length ball, middle and leg, pushed to short midwicket
short of a length, on off, pushed between cover and point for a single
middle and leg, on a length, the bottom hand helps him place this wide of short midwicket
short of a length, punched to the left of short midwicket, but Mahela gets a hand to it, and Shafiq turns down an easy single
fuller, middle and leg, driven down to long-on for one
half-volley on off, driven wide of long-off for a couple
flighted outside off, he lets it turn away into the gloves of Sanga
short legbreak, pulled to midwicket where Senanayake, the substitute, lets it through his legs
short of a length, cut to the left of cover for a single
flighted on off, defended in front of his body
googly, short too, Misbah reads it, pulls it, but Senanayake makes a diving save at midwicket this time
short of a length, middle and off, punched down to long-on for one
length ball, middle and leg, can't beat short midwicket with a push down the ground
short of a length, no room, pushed to straightish extra cover
makes room and drives a half-volley wide of sweeper-cover. Chandimal makes a diving save at the fence

makes room again, Mathews pitches short, Misbah pushes to short cover and runs. Shafiq starts slightly late but runs hard. Thirimanne, despite a taped knee, swoops on it, and flicks it under-arm to catch Shafiq short by a frame. Is fielding the biggest difference between these teams?
length ball outside off, worked wide of midwicket for a single
Akmal dances down the track, turns this into a half-volley, but drives it straight to short cover
uses his feet again, right to the pitch of this, pushed to long-on for one
tossed up outside off, slog-swept to deep midwicket for one
Akmal outside the crease again, the ball dips a little, and he defends in front of his body
this one stays low as it turns away after pitching leg, and is defended back to him
sharp turn this time after pitching short, stays low too, and beats the bat, the keeper and the slip for byes
short of a length, into the pads, Misbah misses as he looks to turn this to leg. Optimistic appeal from Mathews. This is sliding down and bouncing over the top too
length ball, outside off, driven to long-on for one
nice shot. Akmal walks down the wicket, Mathews slips down leg, and he glances it fine, much fine of fine leg for four
walks down the track again, Mathews pitches short, and he steers it to third man
short of a length, middle and off, worked into the on side for one
down the wicket again, Mathews bowls short, and he works him into the on side for another single
picks the slower ball, tries the slog over midwicket, gets an inside edge onto the pad. A single taken
missed put. Full, down the leg side, and Misbah whips down the wrong line. Akmal calls him through for a leg-bye
short, into the body, fine leg is pretty square, and Akmal has guided this fine, just a help away, for a four
short again, outside off this time, chest high, sways out of the line
slower ball, 121ks, picks it again, looks to turn it down fine, but is beaten by extra bounce
slower ball, 124ks, no room there, defended to cover-point
pushed into the on side, towards the adjacent wicket, and Kula runs into Akmal as he fields. Misbah is not taking the single anyway
slower ball, 104ks, on a length, worked into the on side for a single
walking down the track again, slower ball again, nudged to short fine leg for a single
Misbah is making room, then sees a low full toss outside off, and drives it wide of sweeper-cover for two
backs away, then moves back, digs this yorker out for a single square on the off side
down the wicket again, Kula refuses to give him pace again, and Akmal nudges him to leg for a single again. Cat-and-mouse stuff
length ball, into the pads, flicked away, but finds midwicket
slower ball, 122ks, middle and off, punched to point
makes room to try to go over mid-off, Malinga stays straight and full, following him, and this goes between Akmal and the leg stump
short, into the body, and not the ball to bowl with the fine leg in the circle. Akmal swivels, uses the pace, helps it away, using the pace, and over short fine leg
backs away a long way, Malinga stays full and straight, in front of leg, and Akmal just about gets bat on it
Malinga is short and down leg again. Surprising lack of thought from Malinga. The fine leg is up, and Akmal helps it along again. Fine of short fine leg this time
makes room, Kula bowls a full toss outside off, and he comes back to smash it square for a four. Poor delivery
slower ball, middle and leg, helped away for a single
length ball, outside off, driven to mid-off
making room, yorker just outside off, beaten

walks down the track, premeditating to try to work this fine of short fine. And gets a leading edge to a full toss. Straight to short cover, and wants a single. Rightly sent back. A direct hit would have had him
makes room now, Kula follows him with a bouncer. Beaten on the upper-cut
full toss on off, hit back at him, Malinga gets a hand to it
slower-ball gone wrong, full toss on the pads, and Misbah finds short fine leg. Misbah misses out
half-volley outside off, driven to sweeper-cover for one
slower ball, on a length outside off, played wide of point for one
full outside off, driven square for a single
bouncer it is, but the gets the line wrong. Well outside off, giving him room to slash. Slash Akmal does, and gets a top edge over Sanga's head
full, on off, driven to long-off for one
Akmal down the wicket, not to the pitch of it, and hence pushes it to long-off for just a single
short and flat, pulled to long-on for a single
short of a length, tries to run it down fine, but there is no pace to work with. Ends up paying it to point
Akmal gives him the charge, Mendis bowls full and down leg to cramp him up. Inside edge into the pad
tries the cut again, but again the lack of pace means he can't go finer than point
short of a length, outside off, guided to third man for one

Bang. Akmal has been lining this up for a long time, but at times he has not got the pace, at others the length. Now he gets a perfect delivery. On a length, middle and leg, gentle pace, and he is down on a knee to slog him well over deep midwicket
slightly shorter, on off, defended back to him
length ball again, just outside off, Akmal goes for another slog, but the ball stays low, and beats him
short of as length, outside off, takes a single to short third man
length ball, pushed to mid-on for a single
short, flat, punched down to long-off for one
googly, Akmal charges and swings nonetheless, and the mis-hit means it doesn't carry to deep midwicket
short, outside off, pulled down to long-on for one
flighted on middle and leg, solid forward-defensive from Akmal
picks the google, sweeps this to deep square for one

slog-sweep, and caught at deep midwicket. Mendis has bowled really well. Doesn't give them any pace to work with. Bowled at 73ks, Misbah has to wait and wait, and doesn't get the timing right. Caught at deep midwicket
short of a length, on off, punched to long-off for one
no golden duck here. Punches this down to long-off for a single. All along the ground
Akmal is lining up Perera's length balls at 125ks. Slogs again, gets a lot of height, but clears deep midwicket with ease
another length ball, driven down to long-on now for a single
poor delivery. Down the leg side with fine leg up. Afridi plays it smartly, glancing it fine, fine of the man
short of a length, outside off, punched away, but finds the straight extra cover
googly, picked early, and worked to leg for a single
legbreak, starts from outside leg, helped away for another single
well bowled again, doesn't give him the driving or slogging length. Nor the room. Pushed to cover
follows it up with a googly, worked away for a single
flat, into the pads, just the single to deep midwicket
again short of a driving length, and fuller than what can be pulled. Gets a single to long-on. Another good over from Mendis. Will he get another?
length ball, on off, 136ks, driven back to him
slower ball outside off, he tries to run it down, but misses. He has picked it, but is trying to run it too fine
yorker, dug out, the ball is on the pitch, but Afridi calls him through for one. Akmal reaches fifty. Does the sajda. Kisses the badge on the helmet. Acknowledges the response from his team-mates
slower ball, outside off, played with an open face, gets a single to deep point
picks the slower ball again, plays the slog-sweep, but can't beat midwicket
well bowled. Inswinging yorker, in front of middle and leg, dug out. Lovely over. Just two off
Afridi wanted to his this one back to the hotel, but gets an inside edge onto the boot for one
slower ball, he picks it again, but t never arrives and beats the cut shot. That's bowled at 94ks
another slower ball, 95ks, no room either, punched to point for one

full toss, and Afridi has picked out deep midwicket to perfection. This is a poor result for Pakistan. This is exactly the delivery you want at death, but Afridi has hit it off the lowest fourth of the bat, and Mahela doesn't have to move an inch at deep midwicket
on the pads again, worked away for a single
length ball, outside off, nicely driven to sweeper-cover for a single
short, just outside off, 143ks, wants to guide it fine with an open face but makes no contact
the rare loose delivery. On a length, on the pads, and he has flicked it over square leg, never mind the slower delivery
another slower ball, outside off this time, run down to third man for one
well bowled, he guesses Akmal will back away, and bowls full and wide, just inside the wide guide line. Akmal can't reach it
full, yorker, outside off, Akmal wants to slog it to leg, and misses it completely
another wide length ball to counter Akmal's movement away from the stump, but this time he has gone a touch too wide, and is called

well bowled. Akmal is one-dimensional, and proving easy to outdo at the death. Any bull full and outside off is beating him because he is looking to slog everything over midwicket. Smart bowling from Malinga
full, on off, driven to long-on for one
charges at him, Kula bowls the slower ball, and despite all his power he has hit it back to Kula
another slower ball, 93ks, no room, gets a single to point
yorker outside off, hit back to Kulasekara. This is a smart finish from Sri Lanka so far
another yorker outside off, a low full toss really, hit down the ground, Kula leaps in his follow-through, and fields overhead
low full toss again, wide outside off, driven down to long-on
slower ball, too good for Tanvir, gets a leading edge, but Tharanga has dropped a sitter at long-off. two extra runs conceded
full and outside off, gets a single to extra cover
full and wide, Akmal has backed away, and hardly reaches it, gets a single to cover
another leading edge from Tanvir, this time Tharanga runs in towards the 30-yard circle and takes the catch
more premeditation. He is moving across this time, Malinga bowls a wide yorker again, and he somehow gets some bat on it to take a single

wide length ball, and unlike Akmal, Gul goes over the off side, and gets a couple over point. Thirimanne, who has been superb in the field, gives chase from sweeper-cover, and makes a diving save at the boundary

inn2.comm: length ball, outside off, allowed to go through. No swing or seam
direct hit from Pakistan early on. Short of a length, into the hip, tucked away to square leg. Easily in despite the direct hit
ordinary delivery. Too straight to start off with, and then seams further in, and it flies off the thigh pad. Already four extras. Sri Lanka conceded eight in the whole innings
good comeback. Extra bounce from short of a length, and just outside off. Left alone by Dilshan
into the pads again, and helped away fine of deep square
short of a length, outside off, steered away to third man for one
horror start for Tanvir with a big wide down the leg side. SL bowled their first wide in the 19th over
edged and short. Good comeback delivery. Short of a length, on leg, making him play, seaming away, squaring him up, taking the edge, which falls well short of second slip
another wide down the leg side. SL bowled three in the whole innings
another good delivery now. Short of a length, middle and off, seaming away. Left alone
leg side again, worked away off the pads for a single
length ball outside off, comes forward, lets it be
another leave outside off. Watchful start from Tharanga
another length ball outside off, another leave
Mix-up and mess-up. Dilshan pushes towards mid-on, wants a drop and run, Tharanga doesn't. Shafiq charges in, can go at either end, but he doesn't pick it up cleanly
length ball, outside off, allowed to angle away to the keeper
Tharanga pushes outside off, and nearly edges it. Short of a lenght, seaming away, he goes after it, and is beaten. Extravagant swing after passing the stumps. Sarfraz does well to get a hand to it
no adventure this time, leaves it be outside off
finally gets bat to ball, punching this to square third man for a single
short of a length, plays the short-arm pull, gets a single to fine leg
full, middle and leg, angling towards off, plays the classical off drive, between the bowler and mid-off
length ball, pitched outside leg, hits the pad in front of leg
short of a length, pitched outside off. He drives, playing for the angle. The ball holds its line. Beaten
this one straightens outside off again, left alone again
really wide of the crease, angling in towards his hip, tucks him up

Timber. Tanvir's angle does him in. Or does it? They are checking for the no-ball. They are checking it for the back-foot no-ball. He is well in there, and also with the front foot. So Tanvir can continue celebrating. Top-quality bowling. After getting two to straighten outside off, he bowls one at the almost acute angle. Dilshan falls over when driving, the ball hits the pad, and then canons into the stumps. They nearly snatched that smile away when they went upstairs, but Tanvir was well in on both counts
length ball, outside off, left alone

Huge appeal from Gul. Tharanga follows a length ball outside off, and seems to have been beaten by the angle. Close to the edge, but no touch on it. Only Gul appeals instantaneously, and the rest join him later. Correct call from Reifell
short of a length, outside off, left alone
short of a length, on middle and off, defended with an open face
extra bounce, Tharanga is surprised. Short of a length, 137ks, on off, kicks at him, Tharanga takes the bottom hand off in defence
short of a length, middle and leg, defended to leg. 140ks now. Gul hitting his rhythm now
length ball, angling in towards off, defended
full outside off, swinging the other way, driven nicely to cover. Sanga's bat making a sweet sound
left alone outside off, the ball swings after passing the stumps, and Sarf must be wondering if he is in Colombo or Cardiff
full, outside off, swinging away, driven to cover
short of a length, gives him the width, Sanga goes after it, cuts it uppishly through the vacant gully region. First run in 16 balls

How do you play these? Too good from Tanvir. Slightly slower, 126ks, short of a length, on off, Tharanga plays for the angle, but the ball holds its line, squares him up, beats the edge, and hits the off stump. Cartwheeling goes the off stump
short of a length, on off, no room, pushed to cover
short of a length, outside off, left alone, bounces in front of the keeper
short of a length, pitches leg, heads towards off, defended solidly
no room again, pitching leg, headed towards off, defended to mid-on

Sanga cashes in on the width. A rare wide delivery from Gul, and Sanga cuts it between point and cover-point. Akmal gives chase, dives over the ball, and then drags it in on the third attempt even as he slides towards the rope. First runs off Gul in the last 11 balls
length ball, angling in, pushed to square leg
angled too far down leg, called wide
another wide down leg - Pakistan have conceded eight extras already, the same number as Sri Lanka in the whole innings. I suspect this happens when you put in extra effort
short of a length, widish, left alone
lovely cut. too short, not too wide, but Sangakkara seems to be in form tonight. Gets right on top of it, and cuts it between point and gully
short of a length, just outside off, left alone
short of a length again, not too wide, left alone again
fuller, outside off, left alone again
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to cover
nice shot. Short of a length, angling in, meets it with a slightly closed face, and times it past mid-on
length ball, on off, defended back to him
angling in towards off, 137ks, worked to square leg
short of a length, 139ks, outside off, hits the sticker on the bat
fuller, straighter, Chandimal's bat comes down in time
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to cover
worked away square on the on side, square of fine leg
another wide down the leg side
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to cover
pitched up, outside off, holds its line, left alone
holds its line outside off again, shoulders arms again
cut away, Umar Akmal gets it on a half-volley at point, and the fumble allows them a single
short of a length, angling in, worked away past square leg
length ball, on off, defended back to him
pitched up, driven down to long-off for one
flighted on off, turning in a little, defended back to him
overpitched, driven down to long-on for one
topspinner, pitches in front of off, hits the inside half of the bat
short of a length, on off, hit back to Hafeez
139ks first ball, length ball, just outside off, defended
half-volley outside off, 144ks, driven straight to cover
full, on off, 145ks, driven to mid-off
length ball, outside off, 140ks, defended to cover
149.4ks. Full, angling in, gets an inside edge that goes for a single
top shot. Length ball, 143ks, no swing, Sanga drives it down the ground, and past a sluggish dive from the fielder at mid-on. Tanvir is the culprit. Misbah shows anger
length ball, on the pads, pushed down to long-on
topspinner, 82ks, defended back to him
full, on the pads, pushed wide of mid-on for one
muted appeal for lbw, but this pitches on leg, and turns down
another offbreak, just outside off, 82ks, defended
shimmies down the track, beaten in the flight, defends it back to him
short of a length, 145ks, played with an open face to point
length ball, middle and leg, moving towards off, pushed back to him
digs this in short, 141ks, rising towards the chest, fended to point
short of a length, angling across, runs this down to third man for one
length ball, angling in, helped away to fine leg
length ball, outside off, angling away, and left alone
tospinner, pitches leg, angles towards off, defended back
short of a length, on the pads, helped away for a single
length ball, into the pads of the left-hand batsman now, helped around the corner
toppie again, 86ks, Chandi plays for the offbreak, ends up playing it back to him
offbreak now, and too straight, and he places it to the left of fine leg, and takes a couple
flighted on middle and leg, worked away into the leg side
short of a length, outside off, tapped to point
short, wide, but gets big on him, at 144ks, as he tries to cut. Does well to keep it down, though
sliding down leg, 144ks, Chandimal misses out, and gets just a leg-bye
short of a length, on the pads, tucked away for a single

Tanvir won't get an EPL contract for sure. This is cut in front of square, Tanvir runs to his right, sticks the right boot out, the ball bounces into the left shin, and goes for four. How long before Misbah starts screaming at these guys?
length ball, into the pads, pushed wide of midwicket for one
flighted on leg, defended to midwicket
length ball, middle and leg, defended back to him
short of a length, on the pads, pushed to long-on for one
short of a length, punched to the right of Hafeez, who dives to save one run
flighted on middle and leg, gets a single to long-off now
toppie, on off, defended back to him
quick, short of a length, gets a leading edge as he tries to work this to leg, goes for a single to deep point
length ball, on off, 144ks, pushed wide of mid-on for one
wide down the leg side
steered wide of third man, comes back for two, Gul's throw is flat and powerful, but slightly wide
they are picking on Tanvir everywhere. This is tucked straight to him at short fine, and they steal the single
Chandimal has dived into the stumps. Pushed to cover for a quick single, and he rushes through, and slides right into them at the non-striker's end

If only Pakistan could field. I am amazed the Pakistan bowlers over the last five years have not procured arms and opened fire in public places. Length ball, big drive, healthy edge, to the left of Sarf. He grabs at it, in she goes, out she comes. Sami's hands are on his head, fielding coach shakes his head, Sarf's head is hidden in his glove. Fifty up for the partnership
Has Sarf redeemed himself? Sharp stumping. This offbreak dips on Sanga, turns across his bat, Sarf is really quick with the stumping, but the back foot never leaves the crease or the ground
length ball, middle and leg, turning towards off, defended back to him
slower through the air, pitches middle and off, turns away, Sanga pushes at it, and is beaten
short of a length, driven on the up, to cover-point
oh what a ripper. Slower again, dipping, landing in front of middle and leg, Sanga plays a defensive shot, and is beaten by the turn
Another chance gone. Sanga drops and runs. Then stops. Then sees Chandi coming, and goes. Akmal rushes in from point, but fails to pick the ball up
short, wide, cut away to deep point
now they rub it in for Sami. Short of a length, quick, but wide, and he uses all the pace with an open face, placing it wide of point. That will take pressure off Sanga
short, into the body, off the thigh it goes fine of short fine
short of a length, outside off, runs it down to third man for one
length ball, outside off, pushed to sweeper-cover for one
length ball outside off, pushed to short cover
short of a length, turning in, pushed to long-on for one
flighted on off, 87ks, defended back
short of a length, helped away off the pads
flatter, quicker, beats the outside edge with no turn
regulation legbreak, pushed to square leg
looks to run this down, but Akmal is alert at short third
flighted on off, runs off the thick edge towards point
flighted outside off, solidly driven down to long-off
short of a length, quick, pushed to midwicket
length ball, outside off, quicker one, beats the cut. Should have played forward
slower through the air, on off, no turn, defended with an open face
length ball, on off, pushed back to Hafeez
looks to cut Afridi. Length ball, 97ks, gets a bottom edge
full, outside off, driven to long-off
big big legbreak. Sanga is looking to cut this, and this one cramps him up. Bottom edge again
fuller legbreak, pushed to straight midwicket

it's Sami's turn now. The straighter one from Afridi, off the outside half of the bat, Sami misjudges at short third man, and allows a couple. Waqar Younis sums it up, "If you are a Pakistan, close your eyes on this replay."
full, middle and leg, lapped fine by Sanga
length ball, outside off, pushed to cover
short of a length, outside off, punched to straight extra cover
slower through the air, turns sharply, gets the edge, and they sneak in a single to Tanvir at short third man
angling away after pitching on off, gets a single to wide of point
overpitched on the pads, worked away for a single into the leg side
length ball, on the pads, worked away for a single
slider, middle and off, driven to long-on for one
runs down to short third and steals another single. It's Sami again
legbreak, driven from outside off, to sweeper-cover
gives him the charge, takes this on the full, and places it wide of midwicket for a four. Ominous signs for Pakistan

the topspin off Sanga's bat has got him here. He looks to drop and run, the ball bounces on the pitch, and to the left of Sarfraz as opposed to going down the wicket. Sarfraz has redeemed himself with a sharp one-handed collection, and the run-out. Sanga had taken only two steps down the wicket

Afridi is standing with his chest jutting out and arms in the air, the rest of the fielders are all over him, and the crowd is stunned. Softest of dismissals. Flighted on off, Mahela looks to defend this, but returns a soft lob to Afridi
length ball, middle and leg, defended back to him
short of a length, into the pads, takes a leg-bye
short of a length, outside off, defended back to him
short of a length, into the pads, and Mathews is off the mark with a clip
length ball, on off, 136ks, defended to cover
short of a length, worked away for another single
length ball, middle and leg, defended back to him
length ball, defended to straight midwicket
flighted on off, defended back to him
length ball, on the pad, worked away for a single
flighted on off, defended off the front foot
full and quick, on the pads, and through the legs of midwicket. It's substitute Abdur Rehman now
length ball, holding its line outside off, left alone
length ball, on off, defended to cover
bouncer, 139ks, Mathews wants to pull, but pulls out of the shot at the last moment
another bouncer, sharper and higher now, 138ks, and Mathews sways out. Called one for the over. Misbah applauds
short of a length, 140ks, heavy ball too, hits the sticker of the bat
short of a length, gets big on him again, sliced through the vacant gully region
full, outside off, defended
slower, slightly shorter, straightens after pitching in front of leg, hits the pad
full, on the pads, hit back to him
flighted, 84ks, middle and off, another block
full, 89ks, driven to long-on for one
slower, 86ks, turns off a length, stops at him too. Defended towards cover
Mathews comes down the track, Gul stays short of a length, a defensive shot ensues
short of a length again, punched to sweeper-cover for one

not an easy catch, but a drop nonetheless. Pulled away, but for some reason Azhar Ali was a few yards from the rope, and had to backtrack. Had he been on the fence, this was a comfortable, chest-high catch. Now he is off balance, and it hits the hands rather than the hands accepting it
length ball, on off, defended to cover
another bouncer from Gul, but this one is rather tame, and Mathews has swiped this in front of square, and through deep midwicket for four
punched nicely, straight to short extra cover, though

turn, edge and through. I have been wondering why the lone slip is wide. This is a superb legbreak, on a length, on off, turns sharply away, and the edge goes between the keeper and slip. A regulation first slip would have swallowed it. Akmal is the man
driven to long-on for one
soft hands, and they steal a single to short cover
length ball, on leg, defended back to him
short and wide, cut in front of sweeper-cover for two
short of a length, placed wide of point for a single
length ball, offbreak, placed wide of midwicket for one
length ball on the pads again, helped away for another single
topspinner, worked straight to midwicket this time, and is sent back
short now, and pulled away to fine leg for one
short of a length, middle and leg, punched down to long-on
flighted on middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
flighted, middle and leg, gets a single to long-on
quicker one, short of a length, worked away for a single
full, middle and leg, slog-swept, the mis-hit gets him a couple
fifty for Chandimal, his first in a home ODI. Full, on the pads, clipped away
short of a length, drops and runs, cover is on his heels
Unorthodox but effective. Backs away, gets a short ball, and flat-bats it between mid-off and extra cover. This game is dead even
topspinner, pitched outside leg, worked around the corner for one

Chandimal has thrown it away. He has worked hard so far, but he has now gone to one of the three men in the deep. You would expect him to go to unpopulated areas in the Powerplay. Dances down the track, lofts this towards long-on, where Sami slides to high right to take the catch
topspinner, squares him up, goes for the tip-and-run, and makes it
offbreak, middle and off, straightening, defended back to him
full, on off, drilled to mid-off
the toppie again, hits him outside the line of leg, and goes for a leg-bye
short of a length, angling in, defended to cover
short, down the leg side, Sarf dives full-length, but it's a wide nonetheless

Stop the press. Pakistan have another run-out. It's Farhat who is on fire. Full, drilled straight to mid-off, and Perera sets off for the non-single. It was Parera's call, but there was no single available there. Sent back. Farhat has the presence of mind to go to the striker's end, and the throw is accurate too. Sarfraz runs in sharply too, and collects the throw without a mistake, and gets his man
short of a length, extra bounce, even though the pace is just 130ks, and it beats the cut
slightly slower, on off, defended to cover
short of a length, no room, defended back
length ball, into the pads, played straight to short midwicket
reverse-sweep, off the middle of the bat, but straight to short third man
topspinner, hits the outside half of the bat, back to him
that's a reverse-swipe. Full, on the pads, and he has lofted this over point. Extraordinary shot
short of a length, on middle and leg, worked away for one

it has hit the stumps, and the bails haven't come off. Good presence of mind from Sarfraz. Thirimanne backs away to try and smash this, gets the bottom edge into the pitch, Sarfraz lets it bounce a second time, and the ball topspins into the stumps. The stump moves back a couple of inches, but the bail doesn't move from its groove
hit down the ground for a single
legbreak, on off, pushed to point
driven to sweeper-cover for one. This was an offbreak
flighted on off, pushed to cover
full, driven wide of long-on, and Sami is brilliant with his charge, one-handed pick-up and throw

What is up with the bails? Sarfraz has flicked this into the stumps, and it doesn't come off. This was almost a repeat of the Sanga dismissal. He wanted to drop and run, Sarfraz was alert, and flicked back blind. The stump gave, and again didn't come off
wide down the leg side, and past Sarfraz
worked wide of short fine leg for a single
looking to pull, but too quick for him, and he ends up lobbing this over the bowler's head
length ball outside off, driven nicely, to cover
another length ball, hitting the top half of the bat, defended to cover
beaten for pace. Short and wide, he is late into it. A bit of premeditation too. He was going down the ground with this
full and wide,d riven to sweeper-cover for one
full and straight, 144ks, driven down to long-on for one
length ball, outside off, turning in, defended back to him
slower through the air, pushed wide of cover for one
low full toss, driven down to long-on for one
offbreak, pitched on off, straightening, punched down to long-on for one
fired into the pad, 101ks, no room as he backs away. Can't be wided either
tossed up on middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
short and wide, cut wide of third man for two. Farhat does well to run to his right and field
length ball, driven to sweeper-cover for one
nice shot. Thirimanne plays the upper-cut well. This is short, chest-high, and wide. And he goes over point. Two bounces into the fence
short and straight, tucked away off the hip for one
Premeditated, but he has used all of Sami's pace to his own advantage. He was down on the knee early, got under a length ball, and scooped it over short fine leg. It was bowled at 141ks
full and fast, steals a single to cover
a wide fired down leg, and Sarf does well to get a pad to it
defended to cover-point, and Mathews has to dive back after taking two instinctive steps down the wicket
googly outside off, hits the inside half of Mathews's bat
full, driven to long-on for one
short of a length, calmly played to deep cover

full, on the pads, and it's Sri Lanka who have blinked first. It's Sami's third straight inspirational piece of work in the field. Pushed to midwicket, Mathews wants one, Thiri is late to start, and Sami unleashes a flat throw, on the bounce, right by the stumps. Sarfraz doesn't have to do much, and they beat Thiri's dive
flighted outside off, driven to long-off for a single
slower offcutter, too good for Mendis. Doesn't pick it. Beaten outside off
short, 127ks, pulled away to deep square for one
slower ball, short, into the chest, drops it wide of point for one
low full toss, driven straight to mid-off
slower ball, 107ks, short of a length, punched straight to extra cover
short of a length, cut straight to point, sent back. Afridi misses with the throw
slower ball, 117ks, and Sami misfields at square leg. Through the legs. Mixed bag for Sami in the field. That allows them two when there might not have been one
length ball, middle and leg, drives inside-out for a single to long-off
length ball, drilled to mid-off, gets the single
short-arm jab. Slower short ball, he pulls/jabs it wide of square leg. Nicely timed, using Gul's pace
low full toss, driven right of long-off, comes back for two. Direct hit at the striker's end, but Mathews is well in
length ball, driven to long-off, reaches his fifty. Still has work to do
lovely yorker at that angle, 130ks, pushed back to him
another run-out missed. Short of a length, hit straight to square leg, Mendis calls him for one, but Azhar misses the stumps at non-striker's end. He was a goner had he hit
bouncer now, Mendis ducks under it, and looks for the wide call. But this one is right over the stumps. Called one for the over
slower ball gone wrong, wide down the leg side - that's 20 extras, 12 more than what SL conceded
lovely yorker, 132.4ks, can't do anything with it. Just outside off
short of a length, 132ks, short-arm pulled, but straight to midwicket

he has picked the slower ball. I don't know if this was a guess or he saw it from the hand, but Mendis has creamed it, absolutely creamed it. A length ball, angling in, and he has lofted it over long-on
full, outside off, driven to long-off. Akmal fumbles but they take just the one
length ball, on the pads, and Mendis is pulling off a surprise for Pakistan. He is the leading run-getter in domestic cricket. He lofts this length ball over midwicket. Short-arm jab again
gets inside the line of a yorker, picks a single
When will Pakistan hit the stumps? Full toss, hit straight to Misbah at extra cover, and Misbah misses. He was gone had he hit
bouncer, angling down, Mendis looks for a wide on both counts: height and line. Not given either way. Touch and go either way
poor delivery. Full, on the pads, angled in, and helped away for four
full, outside off, drilled to sweeper-cover for one
lovely shot, driven on the up, but he finds extra cover. Sami lucky to get away with a length ball wide outside off
beaten for pace there. A wide length ball again, but he is slightly late, and misses
full and straight, 146ks, concedes a single to midwicket
length ball, middle and leg, 146ks, hitting the bat hard, a single to long-on
full toss, thigh-high, 147ks, surprises him, and he drops it towards cover-point. Top over. One poor ball, but other wise, full and straight
Mathews backs away, Tanvir bowls a wide low full toss. Mathews slices it square, Hafeez makes a diving save at point. There was no back-up behind him

Tanvir strikes at a crucial time again. And we are checking it for a no-ball again. They just don;t trust their eyes with Tanvir. Backs away, Tanvir digs it in short, Mendis toe-ends it, in the air, to extra cover. It nearly slips out of Shafiq's hand, but he holds on, using his chin to balance the ball
driven wide of long-off for two
short of a length, angling in, drops and runs, gets a single
short, into the body, pulled to square leg for one
full, angling in, driven inside-out to long-off for one
full, on off, 135ks, driven wide of long-off, and they come back for two. weak throw from Hafeez
Misbah can't find the stumps again. Near yorker, hit to extra cover, and he was gone if he had hit
unfortunate for Sami. swinging delivery, fast too, but a foll toss. He has done in Kula in for the pace, but he gets an outside edge that goes fine for four
short of a length, on off, punched down to long-off for one
short of a length, Mathews backs away, opens the face in front of stumps, makes good connection, but can't beat short third man
misses the yorker by a few inches, Kula drives well, gets a single to sweeper-cover
picks the slower ball, drills it down to long-off, Akmal is good at long-off
length ball, that was the ball to go after, but Mathews mis-hits it to long-off for another single
near yorker, short by a few inches, dug out to long-on for another single
short of a length, Mathews gets inside the line, misses, takes the leg-bye
Farhat is good again. Half-volley, thrashed towards long-on, Farhat collects it on the half-volley on the second bounce. Keeps them down to one
full toss, Mathews loses his shape, gets a single to extra cover
Cat and mouse. Sami sees him back away, follows him, and Mathews gets inside the line. Wide down the leg side

Another run-out missed. Low full toss, follows him as he backs away, hit to long-on, takes the risky second, Akmal goes for the striker's end, but the throw is wide. There was a run-out available at each end, but he goes for the longer throw and misses, allowing Mathews make it

Mathews it is. Mathews has turned it around. Sami bowls an ordinary delivery. Length ball, outside off, Mathews gets under it, and lofts it over long-on. Bowled cross seam, and gives him the length to get under
short of a length, short-arm jabbed wide of deep midwicket, and he comes back for two. Mathews is panting, bent on his bat, but he has put SL in the driver's seat. Another poor throw. Well wide

Mathews has done it. Tonight he is the iron man. Short of a length, on off, and he punches this over point. Mathews has won them the series, and he is running all over the place with the bat held in the air
